intro: Cryptophragmium, commonly known as the ghost lichen, is a genus of lichens belonging to the family Verrucariaceae. It is characterized by its unique, crust-like growth form and often appears as a pale or whitish film on rock surfaces. The thallus of Cryptophragmium is typically composed of a symbiotic partnership between a fungus and a photosynthetic partner, usually a green alga or cyanobacterium. These lichens are often found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or cliff faces. Their ability to thrive in harsh conditions makes them important indicators of environmental health and stability.
